definition: in spite of/regardless of
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
reckless/regardless of everything
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
outrageous and unconventional (idiom); flying in the face of (authority, convention, public opinion etc)
regardless of what's before or after (idiom); rushing blindly into sth
regardless of life or death (idiom)
to say one thing and do another (idiom)

sentences.english: You're mad because he lied to you.
sentences.chinese: 你因爲他對你撒了個謊就氣得不顧一切了。

sentences.english: The rebel lawmakers denounced his proposal as reckless.
sentences.chinese: 內訌的議員斥責他的提案不顧後果。

sentences.english: He threw caution to the winds and began arguing with the manager.
sentences.chinese: 他什麼也不顧了，和經理爭辯起來。

sentences.english: To let us go first, the goat pounces on the wolves strongly.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓我們先走，大山羊不顧死活地朝狼羣撲了過去。

sentences.english: The guard guards the guarantee in the garden regardless of the hazard.
sentences.chinese: 衛卒不顧風險看管着花園裏的典質品。

sentences.english: The boy pressed on in spite of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩不顧風而努力前進。

sentences.english: Ignoring those, the remaining central shape is nondescript.
sentences.chinese: 不顧這些，其餘的中央形狀是不倫不類。

sentences.english: The absolute being suddenly changed the entire battlefield and neglected the additional people's dead Gua no matter.
sentences.chinese: 神，突然就改變了整個戰場，不管不顧別人的死括。

sentences.english: Jarvis on behalf of the senior members of the People's Party, accused Carl Singh, "regardless of public opinion."
sentences.chinese: 人民黨高級成員賈維代卡爾指責辛格“不顧民意”。

sentences.english: He didn't pretend to be aloof to despise the girl in whorehouse .
sentences.chinese: 他也不會故做清高，拾青樓女子於不顧。

sentences.english: Fixating on a single enemy at the expense of everything else is likely to get you flanked and killed.
sentences.chinese: 只盯着一個敵人而不顧其他可能會要你的命。

sentences.english: Their slums are filled with desperatelypoor people who have fled worse poverty in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 那裏的貧民區住滿了不顧一切逃離最貧窮鄉村的窮人。

sentences.english: Like the sea of science, and require desperate struggle.
sentences.chinese: 科學如同大海，要求奮不顧身的拼搏。

sentences.english: He thought of all the times he had gone about his work without thinking about and noticing her.
sentences.chinese: 他想起了那些埋頭工作，置愛妻子於不顧的日子。

sentences.english: High achievers, however, set their compass and then essentially put it away.
sentences.chinese: 然而，成功人士設置好指南針而實質上把它置於不顧。

sentences.english: I will stand by them, and I won't walk out just because they do kookie things.
sentences.chinese: 我要支持他們，我不能因爲他們做了蠢事就棄之不顧。

to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
